app.title: Google Gemini
app.description:
Supercharge your creativity and productivity with Gemini, your AI assistant from Google.

Gemini gives you direct access to Google’s best family of AI models on your phone so you can:

- Go Live with Gemini to brainstorm ideas, simplify complex topics, and rehearse for important moments. Just click on the Gemini Live button in your Gemini app
- Connect with your favorite Google apps like Search, YouTube, Google Maps, Gmail, and more
- Study smarter and explore any topic with interactive visuals and real-world examples
- Turn any file into a podcast that you can listen to anytime, anywhere
- Create stunning images from just a few words
- Plan trips better and faster
- Get summaries, deep dives, and source links, all in one place
- Brainstorm new ideas, or improve existing ones

Level-up your Gemini app experience by upgrading to the Pro plan–unlock new and powerful features to tackle complex tasks and projects and enjoy industry-leading 1M token context window (enabling Gemini to process up to 1,500 pages of text or 30k lines of code), and:
- Get more access our most powerful model, like 2.5 Pro
- Generate and dive into detailed reports on any topic with Deep Research powered by 2.5 Pro
- Turn words into high-quality, 8 second video clips with video generation with Veo 2, and more. 

Google AI Pro is available in 150 countries and territories, and includes additional benefits. Gemini app, as part of Google AI Pro, will continue to be available to qualifying Google Workspace business and education plans. Learn more: https://gemini.google/subscriptions/

Get the best of Gemini [app] by upgrading to the Ultra plan–unlock the highest level of access and exclusive features to turn anything into anything. Get the highest access to Google’s most powerful model, like 2.5 Pro, and features like video generation with Veo 3 and Deep Research. You’ll also get early access to try our newest AI innovations as they become available, including Agent Mode.

Gemini in Google AI Ultra is available in the US and includes additional benefits as part of a Google AI Ultra subscription. Google AI Ultra is not currently available to Google Workspace business and education customers. Learn more: https://gemini.google/subscriptions/

If you opt in to the Gemini app, it will replace your Google Assistant as the primary assistant on the phone. Some Google Assistant voice features aren't available through the Gemini app yet. You can switch back to Google Assistant in settings.

Review the Gemini Apps Privacy Notice:
https://support.google.com/gemini?p=privacy_notice

app.summary: Chat to start writing, planning, learning and more with Google AI

reviews.text: I love Gemini, as a writer. It gives me the real time feedback I am craving. What areas are strong, what are weak, suggestions to improve it. I can't express just how useful this is as a creative writing tool. I even learned a few things about the Titanic I didn't know just by asking for obscure information on it. If you're on the edge, I would definitely give it a try. (The voice you hear on the YouTube commercials is called Orbit, but there are several others to choose from -- male and female

This is so great! it's much more natural than just using Google Assistant. It has a little bit of difficulty realizing that a pause doesn't necessarily mean that you're done speaking. That can happen in normal conversations too, but it's a little more pronounced here, because it can see facial cues that you're still talking, like a person could. Fantastic feature, I'm sure I'm going to be using this a lot!

They fixed the play button. Awesome. When responding with audio, it cuts off if the phone goes to sleep/locks. This is EXTREMELY annoying. especially while driving. That's my biggest complaint. Another certain AI app continues playing the audio after the phone goes to sleep. Very good app and phone assistant but I keep hearing they want to put ads in Gemini. if they do that, I'm out.

I love the Gemini app. It's great and highly resourceful to me. Currently, the only thing I want them to fix is the 'reading out loud' feature which doesn't allow users to scroll through the audio while listening to a response. Instead, we have to listen to the entire thing. So, it would be nice to be allowed to scan through the audio.

Sadly forced in the latest update to android, but forces itself in ways that undo the previously intuitive hands-free features. giving me AI, which makes mistakes, instead of hands-free, which was highly tuned to a good experience and allowed me to do voice operations while driving with out concern, is a major downgrade. AI buzzwords is not a valid justification for properly functioning software. I don't want software to make mistakes. I want to be able to rely on it.
reviews.replyText: Hi Marshall, thanks for flagging. Our team is aware of this issue and is working on a fix. Appreciate your patience.

reviews.text: Gemini just replaced my google assistant after recent update. Gemini fails to complete simple tasks like giving me directions. When I ask for directions somewhere it tells me that it would have to get directions to that place. It struggles sending text messages instead it thinks about it and then turns off. When google replaces your assistant it should at least work as well as the app it replaces.
reviews.replyText: Hi there. The Gemini mobile app can now send text messages through your phone’s default messaging app. For now, it cannot help you create or message group chats or send audio, images, or videos. Learn more: goo.gle/3Z5xOiM. If this happens again, please Open the Gemini App > tap top right profile picture/initial > Feedback > Send feedback. Thanks.

reviews.text: Updating the four stars. Lately I have been quite pleased with Gemini's performance. It certainly has its moments, but they are absolutely paying attention to this app. I feel like there have been several very specific instances of me submitting feedback and the feedback being responded to. :) It would be nice if you could submit a custom screenshot when submitting feedback? Usually it takes a screenshot of *where* you tapped "send feedback", and usually that is only available on the main page.
reviews.replyText: Hi Doug. Thank you for your feedback - you can now type or use your voice to ask Gemini to play music on YouTube Music. Pause, stop, and control volume by using your voice in the Gemini app, or directly in the YouTube Music app. Appreciate it.

reviews.text: I had an update on my phone. it prompted me to try making an 8-second video through Gemini advanced. I tried it once but now I'm stuck in the make video mode. it won't go back to being able to carry on. at the conversation with the AI I've contacted support. nobody can seem to figure this out now. my Gemini that I paid $20 a month for is now stuck in the video mode and that's all it can do. very frustrated

This is, by far, the best upgrade you have ever made in a Samsung phone! I am indeed, extremely thankful, as the Metropolitan Archbishop in the United States, that I am able to do more things and functions with better alacrity, effectiveness, and completeness! You should have made these upgrades last year! I never liked Bixby; I always believed that software was a complete waste; however, your new software for Gemini AI assistant is absolutely marvelous! What I next, is better voice software!

Update as of 12/25/24. You still can't seem to use the Gemini app without switching your assistant. So I tried it out for a bit and reminders don't work. I was using Gemini just a few months ago and now I can't open the app unless I switch from Google Assistant. This is a huge detractor. Gemini is not a good assistant yet, it doesn't easily set reminders for example. But I did want to use it for queries. Can't seem to open the app to do that. Disappointing because it worked a few weeks ago.

app.developerLegalAddress: 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy, Mountain View, CA 94043, United States
app.recentChanges:
The Gemini app is now available in English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Chinese, Japanese, Korean and more. See the full list of supported languages and countries here:
https://support.google.com/?p=gemini_app_requirements_android
app.AIReview:
Google Gemini Review – A Promising First Step for Mobile AI

Overview

Google Gemini is a productivity app leveraging Google’s advanced AI models, aiming to become your go-to assistant for brainstorming, learning, and creative tasks. With over 456 million installs and a robust 4.5-star rating based on 8.13 million user reviews, the app has quickly gained traction as a key player in the burgeoning mobile AI space. The core promise is access to Google’s most powerful AI – previously confined to web interfaces – directly within your phone's ecosystem. The free price point further fuels its popularity, making it an accessible entry point for users curious about exploring generative AI on the go. However, early adoption reveals both exciting potential and areas where Google needs to refine Gemini’s capabilities and user experience to truly establish itself as a dominant force.

Key Features

Gemini is built around several core functionalities designed to streamline daily tasks:

  • Gemini Live: This feature allows users to initiate real-time conversations with the AI for brainstorming, simplifying complex ideas (e.g., explaining quantum physics in layman’s terms), and even practicing presentations or speeches. The ability to “Go Live” suggests a focus on interactive and dynamic use cases.
  • App Integration: Seamless connectivity with popular Google apps – Search, YouTube, Maps, Gmail, etc. – is central to Gemini's strategy. Users can leverage AI-powered summaries of search results, generate creative video ideas from YouTube searches, get detailed directions enhanced by real-time information via Maps, or draft emails using Gmail’s intelligent assistance.
  • Interactive Visual Learning: The app incorporates interactive visuals related to learning and exploration. This feature is intended to transform passive learning into an engaging experience, providing dynamic representations of complex topics. Specific examples of this functionality are still somewhat limited in the current version.
  • Chat Interface: The fundamental interaction revolves around a chat interface for initiating prompts, receiving responses, and continuing conversations with Google AI. This core functionality drives much of the app’s utility.

Strengths

Several aspects contribute to Gemini's initial success:

  • Leveraging Google's AI Powerhouse: The underlying technology is undoubtedly impressive. The access to Google’s flagship AI models provides a level of intelligence and capability that many competing mobile apps lack. Responses are often remarkably accurate, insightful, and surprisingly nuanced.
  • Seamless Google Ecosystem Integration: Connecting with familiar Google services creates immediate value for users already invested in the Google ecosystem. The integration feels natural and intuitive, making it easy to incorporate Gemini into existing workflows. For example, quickly summarizing a lengthy YouTube video or generating a map route based on a conversational query is genuinely useful.
  • Large User Base & Positive Reviews: The sheer number of installations (456 million+) and the high rating (4.5 stars) indicate significant user satisfaction and widespread adoption. This positive momentum provides Google with valuable data and feedback for ongoing development.
  • Free Access: The app’s free availability dramatically lowers the barrier to entry, allowing a vast audience to experiment with AI without financial commitment.

Areas for Improvement

Despite its strengths, Gemini has several areas needing attention:

  • Response Speed & Consistency: While generally intelligent, response times can be inconsistent, occasionally feeling laggy, particularly when utilizing complex prompts or multiple app integrations simultaneously. This negatively impacts the flow of conversation and overall usability.
  • Limited Visual Learning Depth: The interactive visual learning feature feels underdeveloped compared to its potential. The available visuals are often static images rather than dynamic representations, hindering a truly immersive learning experience.
  • Prompt Engineering Guidance: The app lacks robust guidance on effective prompt engineering – how to phrase requests for optimal results. Users need better tools and tutorials to effectively leverage Gemini's capabilities. Many users will likely struggle to get the most out of it without this support.
  • Contextual Awareness: While integration with Google apps is strong, Gemini’s contextual awareness within the chat itself could be improved. Maintaining conversation history and referencing previous prompts more consistently would significantly enhance its conversational abilities.

User Experience

The user interface (UI) is clean and intuitive, reflecting Google's design philosophy. The primary chat interface is well-organized, with a clear distinction between input and output. Navigation is straightforward, allowing users to easily access the Gemini Live feature and explore app integrations. However, the UI could benefit from more visual cues and interactive elements to enhance engagement – particularly within the 'Gemini Live' mode. The current presentation feels somewhat static and lacks the dynamism expected of an AI assistant.

Value for Money

As a free application, Google Gemini offers exceptional value. The core features are robust and deliver tangible benefits in terms of productivity and learning. Considering that users gain access to cutting-edge AI technology – previously only available through web interfaces – without any cost, it represents an incredible deal. The potential future monetization strategies (likely premium features or expanded AI model access) will be crucial to the app’s long-term success.

Conclusion

Google Gemini is a promising initial offering in the mobile AI assistant market. It leverages Google's powerful AI technology and integrates seamlessly with the Google ecosystem, making it immediately useful for many users. However, inconsistencies in response speed, limitations in visual learning depth, and a lack of prompt engineering guidance need to be addressed. With ongoing development and refinement, Gemini has the potential to become the go-to AI assistant on mobile devices. Currently, it's a strong contender but not yet a flawless experience – one that warrants continued monitoring and provides a valuable glimpse into the future of AI assistance.
